author: Almabeach
title: Great cute little set for beginners and parents
review:
My mother bought this set for his 3 year old grandson who loves firetrucks. Don't worry, I know it's below the age limit but he never puts toys in his mouth and we always supervise when he plays Lego. This is part of the ''Beginners'' collection as it is easy to build and has not many pieces.

This is a fun little set. The firetruck is the main attraction and the most fun to build. The bottom frame of the vehicule is one part which helps the easiness of building it for little kids. The best part is the manlift which is easy and fun to operate. The BBQ is also a cute little part to build. The minifigs are really fun. The BBQ guy has a two-face option (happy and scared) which is something I never saw before. I'm kind of new with the current generation of legos as before last year I had'nt bought or received any new sets since the early 90's.

So it is a little cute self-explanatory sets for beginners and my son has a lot of fun with it. The hot-dog is a nice touch. I even got an extra wiener in the set which was a fun bonus.

author: Puidwen
title: It's a nice set even if it is a kiddie set.
review: While being a kiddie set lego has put in a few interesting parts.  for instance i haven't seen the "bucket" part.  It's an easy build for an adult going together very quickly.  The fire truck is obviously "kiddie" but it does generally look like a fire truck, a three year old toy fire truck but you can tell what's it supposed to be.   The real interesting part is the minifigs.  The BBQ man has a pretty generic panic face print and hair, but on the torso has a very nice shirt print.  The fireman is even better with a grizzled face print, and a excellent looking semi metallic print on the torso and a plain print on the legs.  On both of them the the print is on both sides of the torso.  It's clearly not meant for adults  or older children (The fire truck looks very silly besides my other sets), but it might be a nice set to start a young'un on.

author: fuzthepoet
title: Barbecue Burn Out
review:
I have bad nerve damage in my hands so my physical therapist recommended Lego's as good for fine motor skills practice. 

 

This was my first build. It wasn't too hard. The tiny hot-dogs were very hard to hold, but beyond that it was good. I was able to complete in one sitting. I love the moving parts.
